title: Tourists who spotted Kevin Rudd in a tiny café in Paris reveal the intimate conversation they had
text:
Two tourists who spotted Kevin Rudd in Paris were thrilled when the former prime minister invited them for a chat and paid for their drinks.

Reddit user Kapinny and a friend were on holiday in Paris when they stumbled across Mr Rudd at a café drinking a glass of wine.

Mr Rudd invited them to sit down and told the pair how is currently studying at Oxford University and his love for Bunnings.

He also asked them about their families and their background then offered to pay for their wine.

Reddit user Kapinny and a friend were on holiday in Paris when they stumbled across Mr Rudd at a café drinking a glass of wine

Kapinny posted a summary about their conversation with the former Prime Minister on Reddit, but they said there are some things they will keep to themselves.

'He only started liking olives at age 50,' Kapinny said on their Reddit post.

'He's currently completing a PhD at Oxford studying the life of Xi Jinping.

'And he spends his weekends often at Bunnings when he's in Australia.'

They sat down and spoke to Mr Rudd who told the pair he is studying at Oxford University and he asked them about their families and their background (stock image)

Kapinny said Mr Rudd seemed like a 'down to earth guy.'

'He asked us about our families and our backgrounds and seemed genuinely interested.'

Mr Rudd replied to Kapinny's post and wished them well in future.

'It was lovely to meet you guys,' Mr Rudd said.

'Hope you have a great trip.'
description: Reddit user Kapinny and a friend were on holiday in Paris when they stumbled across Mr Rudd at a café drinking a glass of wine.
authors: Thomas Duff For Daily Mail Australia
